issue.title: [Rust][Doc] Update feature matrix
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-10917](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-10917). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
The [status matrix](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/docs/source/status.rst) should be updated with the latest Rust additions (for example the C data interface support).

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-10917?focusedCommentId=17257154) by Jorge Leitão (jorgecarleitao):*
Does each of the ticks in "Data Types" correspond to a specific integration test passing? E.g. Rust supports LargeList, but the list does not contain it. Or is it general support without an integration test in place?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-10917?focusedCommentId=17257186) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
I would say general support, but if a type is supported, why isn't the corresponding integration test enabled?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-10917?focusedCommentId=17259958) by Andy Grove (andygrove):*
[~nevi_me]I think you were working on this as part of one of your PRs? Do you think this can still be done for the release (would need to be resolve in the next few days)

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-10917?focusedCommentId=17263565) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Issue resolved by pull request 9123
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/9123>
